unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Relating Characteristics of $\chi^2$
question_text: Which of the following statements about ${ \chi }^{ 2 }$ tests is false?

choices.text: For any particular degrees of freedom, as the value of χ 2 χ 2 increases, the related p p -value will decrease.
A very large χ 2 χ 2 value indicates that the observed counts were far from what was expected.
A very large χ 2 χ 2 value will probably give us reason to reject our null hypothesis.
A χ 2 χ 2 value near 0 0 will likely produce a p p -value near 1 1 .
As the sample size increases, the number of degrees of freedom for a χ 2 χ 2 Goodness of Fit Test will also increase.
